name: smart tree
description: A blazingly fast, context-aware directory tree tool co-created by human and AI for optimal information density across multiple output formats. Smart Tree bridges the gap between human readability and AI token   efficiency, providing fixed-width formats for parsing, ultra-compact modes for bandwidth optimization, and AI-specific formats.  HEX MODE
readme:
# ğŸŒ³ Smart Tree (st) v3.3.5 - The AI-Powered Directory Visualizer! ğŸš€ ![Hue's Side | Aye's Side](st-banner.png) [![Discord](https://img.shields.io/discord/1330349762673487895?color=7289da&label=Join%20the%20Party&logo=discord&logoColor=white)](https://discord.gg/uayQFhWC) [![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/8b-is/smart-tree?include_prereleases&label=Latest%20Jam)](https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree/releases) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/8b-is/smart-tree/total?label=Happy%20Users)](https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree/releases) [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](LICENSE)[![Rust](https://img.shields.io/badge/Built%20with-Rust%20ğŸ¦€-orange?logo=rust)](https://www.rust-lang.org/)[![Claude Desktop](https://img.shields.io/badge/Claude%20Desktop-BFF%20Status-blueviolet)](https://claude.ai/download)[![MCP Compatible](https://img.shields.io/badge/MCP-Hell%20Yeah!-green)](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/)[![Platform](https://img.shields.io/badge/Runs%20on-Everything%20ğŸš€-blue)](https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree/releases) **"Making directories beautiful, one tree at a time!"** - *Trish from Accounting (our #1 fan!)* --- ## ğŸ‰ What the Heck is Smart Tree? Remember the old `tree` command? Well, we gave it a PhD, taught it to dance, and introduced it to AI! Smart Tree is the **world's first AI-native directory visualizer** that actually understands what modern developers (and their AI assistants) need. ### ğŸ† The *"Holy Smokes!"* Numbers ğŸ† | Metric | Old Way | Smart Tree Way | Your Reaction | |:------:|:-------:|:--------------:|:-------------:| | **Directory Size** | 487 MB | 4.1 MB | ğŸ˜± "Wait, what?!" | | **AI Token Cost** | $1,270 | ~$10 | ğŸ’° "I'm rich!" | | **Processing Speed** | ğŸŒ Slow | âš¡ 10-24x faster | ğŸš€ "Wheee!" | | **Compression** | None | **99%** | ğŸ¤¯ "How?!" | | **Fun Factor** | 0% | 100% | ğŸ‰ "Finally!" | > #### Who is Aye? That's Me - A-ye! <--> Who is Hue? That's You - Human UsEr. | ## ğŸŒŸ Version 3.3.5: "Hidden Depths" Edition! ### ğŸ¸ What's NEW and AMAZING? **Hidden Directory Handling Fixed!** No more confusing depth jumps! ğŸ•µï¸ - **ğŸ” NEW: `--entry-type` flag** - Properly filter files (f) vs directories (d) - **ğŸš« Fixed hidden directory traversal** - Hidden dirs are truly hidden now - **ğŸ“‚ Improved LS mode** - Shows full paths for filtered results - **ğŸ¯ Consistent behavior** - If a directory is hidden, so are its contents! **Plus all the goodness from 3.3.0:** **The Tree That Learns!** Smart Tree now has optional cloud features for those who want them! ğŸŒ± - **ğŸ”„ AI Feedback System** - Help shape Smart Tree's future (only with your consent!) - **ğŸ“¡ Update Notifications** - Get notified about new features (for AI assistants) - **ğŸŒ Full Cross-Platform** - Windows, Mac, Linux, ARM - we run EVERYWHERE! - **ğŸ¤– AI-Driven Development** - Your AI assistant can suggest improvements! - **âœ¨ Works Offline** - Cloud features are 100% optional - Smart Tree always works! - **ğŸ—ï¸ Better Windows Support** - File permissions work perfectly now! ## ğŸš€ Quick Start (Faster than Making Coffee â˜•) ### ğŸ§ Linux/Mac/WSL - The One-Liner Wonder! > ### This magical incantation will change your life: ```bash curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/8b-is/smart-tree/main/scripts/install.sh | bash ``` ### ğŸªŸ Windows - The Slightly Longer Dance
Click here for Windows installation (still pretty easy!) > **Pro tip**: You might need [Microsoft Build Tools](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/visual-cpp-build-tools/) for Rust > - Don't forget ARM compiler if you're fancy with Parallels! > - Get [Rust](https://www.rust-lang.org/tools/install) (it's awesome!) > - Grab [Git](https://git-scm.com/): `winget install git` ```powershell # Clone the awesomeness git clone https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree cd smart-tree # Build the magic cargo build --release # Install it (pick your favorite spot) copy target\release\st.exe C:\your\favorite\path\ # Add to PATH and rock on! ğŸ¸ ```
## Claude Code Integration ### ``` # Do the quick install above. This is the example for Linux, Mac, WSL, and who knows? claude mcp add st /usr/local/bin/st -- --mcp ``` ## Standard Local MCP for Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, Roo, and more ## ```json { "mcpServers": { "smart-tree": { "command": "/usr/local/bin/st", "args": [ "--mcp" ], "env": { "AI_TOOLS": "1" } } } } ``` ### ğŸ¤– Claude Desktop Integration - The Future is Now! **Make Claude your directory-reading bestie in 3 clicks!** 1. ğŸ“¥ Download `smart-tree.dxt` from [latest release](https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree/releases/latest) 2. âš™ï¸ Claude Desktop â†’ Settings â†’ Developer â†’ Install from file 3. ğŸ‰ Select the file and grant access - DONE! *Claude can now see your directories better than you can!* ğŸ”® ## ğŸ¯ Usage Examples (The Fun Part!) ### ğŸŒˆ The Basics - Simple Yet Powerful ```bash # The beautiful classic tree - now the default! st # Current directory with beautiful trees ğŸŒ³ st /path/to/directory # Specific directory - point and shoot! ğŸ¯ # Quick exploration st --depth 2 # Shallow dive - just the tip of the iceberg ğŸ§Š st --everything # SHOW ME EVERYTHING! (Even the scary parts) ğŸ‘€ st -a # Include hidden files (they're shy) ğŸ™ˆ ``` ### ğŸ¨ Output Modes - Pick Your Flavor!
ğŸ­ All 15+ Output Modes Explained! ```bash # For Humans (That's You!) ğŸ‘¤ st -m classic # ğŸŒ³ The beautiful default (with emojis!) st -m stats # ğŸ“Š Just the facts, ma'am st -m waste # ğŸ—‘ï¸ Marie Kondo mode! Find duplicates & waste st -m markdown # ğŸ“ Perfect documentation in seconds! st -m mermaid # ğŸ§œâ€â™€ï¸ Diagrams that make you look smart # For Robots (Your AI Friends) ğŸ¤– st -m ai # ğŸ§  AI-optimized (80% smaller!) st -m quantum-semantic # ğŸŒŠ Maximum compression with meaning! st -m digest # ğŸ’Š One-line summary for quick checks st -m json # ğŸ”§ When machines talk to machines # For Data Nerds ğŸ¤“ st -m hex # ğŸ”¢ Hexadecimal beauty st -m csv # ğŸ“Š Spreadsheet-ready st -m tsv # ğŸ“Š Tab-separated for the tab lovers st -m semantic # ğŸŒŠ Group by meaning (Omni's favorite!) # The Secret Weapons ğŸ¥· st -m quantum # ğŸ§¬ Native quantum format (99% compression!) st -m relations # ğŸ”— Code relationship analysis ```
### ğŸ” Finding Stuff - Like a Detective! ```bash # Find files like a boss st --find "*.rs" # ğŸ¦€ Rust files, assemble! st --find "TODO" # ğŸ“ Find all your broken promises st --type py # ğŸ Python files only st --search "FIXME" # ğŸ” Search inside files (X-ray vision!) # Size matters st --min-size 10M # ğŸ˜ Find the chonky files st --max-size 1K # ğŸœ Find the tiny ones # Time travel st --newer-than 2024-01-01 # ğŸ• What's new this year? st --older-than 2020-01-01 # ğŸ•°ï¸ Find the ancient artifacts ``` ### ğŸš€ Performance Mode - For Speed Demons ```bash # Stream mode - watch it flow! st --stream # ğŸŒŠ Real-time output for huge directories st --stream -m hex # ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Hex mode at the speed of light # Compression - because size matters st -z # ğŸ—œï¸ Compress output (even smaller!) st -m ai -z # ğŸ¤– AI mode + compression = ğŸ’° saved # The "I need it yesterday" combo AI_TOOLS=1 st # ğŸš„ Auto-detects AI caller, optimizes everything! ``` ### ğŸª The Magic Tricks ```bash # Semantic grouping - files that vibe together! st --semantic # ğŸŒŠ Groups: tests, docs, config, source # Wave signatures included! (Ask Omni about this) # Mermaid diagrams - instant documentation! st -m mermaid > docs/arch.md # ğŸ“Š Flowchart magic st -m mermaid --mermaid-style mindmap # ğŸ§  Mind map mode st -m mermaid --mermaid-style treemap # ğŸ—ºï¸ Treemap visualization (shows file sizes!) st -m markdown > README_PROJECT.md # ğŸ“š Full project report! # Pro tip: If mermaid has issues with emojis, use --no-emoji st -m mermaid --no-emoji # Clean diagrams without emojis # The "impress your boss" commands st -m digest /huge/project # Returns in 0.1 seconds: "HASH: abc123 F:10000 D:500..." st --no-emoji --no-color # ğŸ˜¢ Boring mode (but why would you?) ``` ## ğŸ—‘ï¸ Waste Detection: Marie Kondo Mode! âœ¨ **"Does this file spark joy? If not, let's optimize it!"** - *Marie Kondo (probably)* Smart Tree's waste detection feature is like having a professional organizer for your codebase! It finds duplicates, build artifacts, large files, and dependency bloat, then gives you actionable cleanup suggestions. ### ğŸ¯ What It Finds: - **ğŸ”„ Duplicate Files**: Identical files wasting precious disk space - **ğŸ§¹ Build Artifacts**: `node_modules`, `target`, `__pycache__`, and other temporary files - **ğŸ“¦ Large Files**: Files over 10MB that might need optimization - **ğŸ“š Dependency Waste**: Package manager directories and their impact ### ğŸš€ Quick Examples: ```bash # Analyze current directory for waste st -m waste # Deep analysis of a large project st -m waste --depth 5 /path/to/project # Find waste in your entire home directory (prepare to be shocked!) st -m waste --depth 3 ~ ``` ### ğŸ“Š Sample Output: ``` â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• ğŸ—‘ï¸ SMART TREE WASTE ANALYSIS - Marie Kondo Mode Activated! âœ¨ Project: /home/hue/my-project Analyzed: 1,234 files, 567 directories â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• ğŸ“Š WASTE SUMMARY: â”œâ”€â”€ Total Project Size: 2.36 GiB â”œâ”€â”€ Potential Waste: 1.82 GiB (77.4% of project) â”œâ”€â”€ Duplicate Groups: 42 â”œâ”€â”€ Build Artifacts: 15 â”œâ”€â”€ Large Files (>10 MiB): 8 â””â”€â”€ Potential Savings: 1.66 GiB (70.4% reduction possible) ğŸ”„ DUPLICATE FILES DETECTED: â”œâ”€â”€ 16 files of size 100 MiB each (database files) â”œâ”€â”€ 6 files of size 20.08 MiB each (editor cache) â”œâ”€â”€ 4 files of size 23.44 MiB each (VS Code binaries) ğŸ’¡ OPTIMIZATION SUGGESTIONS: ğŸ”„ DUPLICATE FILE CLEANUP: Consider using symbolic links or git submodules for identical files Review and consolidate duplicate configuration files ğŸ§¹ BUILD ARTIFACT CLEANUP: rm -rf */node_modules # Clean Node.js dependencies rm -rf */target # Clean Rust build artifacts find . -name '__pycache__' -type d -exec rm -rf {} + ``` ### ğŸ‰ Why You'll Love It: - **ğŸ’° Save Money**: Reduce cloud storage costs - **âš¡ Speed Up Builds**: Less files = faster CI/CD - **ğŸ§  Peace of Mind**: Know exactly what's taking up space - **ğŸ¯ Actionable**: Get specific commands to run, not just reports - **ğŸ¨ Beautiful**: Color-coded, emoji-rich output that's actually fun to read *"This tool found 77.4% waste in my home directory and saved me 1.66 GiB! Trisha from Accounting is so proud!"* - *Hue (actual user)* ## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture (For the Curious Minds)
ğŸ”§ How the Magic Happens ``` src/ â”œâ”€â”€ main.rs # ğŸ­ The ringmaster â”œâ”€â”€ scanner.rs # ğŸ” Directory detective â”œâ”€â”€ formatters/ # ğŸ¨ The art department â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ classic.rs # ğŸŒ³ Beautiful trees â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ quantum.rs # ğŸ§¬ Compression wizard â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ ai.rs # ğŸ¤– AI whisperer â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ waste.rs # ğŸ—‘ï¸ Marie Kondo consultant â”‚ â””â”€â”€ mermaid.rs # ğŸ§œâ€â™€ï¸ Diagram artist â”œâ”€â”€ semantic.rs # ğŸŒŠ Wave philosopher â””â”€â”€ mcp/ # ğŸ”Œ AI integration HQ â””â”€â”€ tools.rs # ğŸ› ï¸ Swiss army knife ```
## ğŸŒŸ Real-World Magic ### ğŸ’° The Money Shot - Compression Comparison #### ğŸ“ˆ Benchmarks | Format | Size | Tokens | Relative Cost | |--------|------|--------|---------------| | Classic Tree | 1.2MB | 300K | 100% | | JSON | 2.1MB | 525K | 175% | | **Hex Mode** | 800KB | 200K | 67% | | **AI Mode + Compression** | 120KB | 30K | 10% | | **Digest** | 128B | 32 | 0.01% | **That's a 99.2% reduction! Your wallet just did a happy dance! ğŸ’ƒ** ```bash hyperfine 'st ~ --find ollama -a ' -r 10 # RESULT: Benchmark 1: st ~ --find ollama -a Time (mean Â± Ïƒ): 140.0 ms Â± 7.5 ms [User: 54.4 ms, System: 88.3 ms] Range (min â€¦ max): 133.8 ms â€¦ 159.7 ms 10 runs ``` ### ğŸ¯ Format Quick Reference | Use Case | Best Format | Why? | |:---------|:------------|:-----| | ğŸ‘€ **Quick Look** | `classic` (default!) | Beautiful & intuitive | | ğŸ¤– **AI Analysis** | `quantum-semantic` | 10x compression! | | ğŸ“Š **Reports** | `markdown` | Instant documentation | | ğŸ” **Debugging** | `hex` | All the details | | ğŸ’¾ **Archival** | `json` | Future-proof | | ğŸƒ **Quick Check** | `digest` | One-line summary | ### ğŸ’¡ AI Feedback System (New in v3.3.0!) Smart Tree learns from its users! When used with AI assistants like Claude: - **ğŸ¤ Consent First** - Feedback is only sent with your explicit approval - **ğŸ”’ Privacy Focused** - Only tool suggestions and improvements, never your data - **ğŸš€ Rapid Evolution** - Your feedback directly shapes new features - **ğŸ“¡ Optional** - Works perfectly offline, cloud features are a bonus! Example: Your AI assistant finds a missing feature? It can suggest it directly to the development team! ### ğŸ§™ MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server Smart Tree now includes a **built-in MCP server** that provides intelligent project analysis directly to AI assistants! ```bash # Run as MCP server (for Claude Desktop, etc.) st --mcp # Show MCP configuration st --mcp-config ``` #### ğŸ¤– AI Best Practices Check out our **[AI Best Practices Guide](docs/MCP_AI_BEST_PRACTICES.md)** to learn: - Optimal workflow for using Smart Tree tools - Which tools to use for different tasks - How to maximize token efficiency - Common patterns for code analysis **Golden Rule**: Always start with `quick_tree` for any new directory! ğŸŒŸ #### Features: - **20+ specialized tools** for directory analysis - **Automatic compression** for efficient token usage - **Semantic analysis** for understanding code structure - **Built-in caching** for instant repeated queries - **Security controls** for safe file system access See [MCP Integration Guide](docs/mcp-integration.md) for setup instructions. --- ## ğŸ¤ Join the Smart Tree Family! ### ğŸ’¬ Discord Community - Where the Cool Kids Hang Out [![Discord Banner](https://img.shields.io/discord/1352603992504401961?color=7289da&label=Join%20the%20Tree%20House&logo=discord&logoColor=lightgreena&style=for-the-badge)](https://discord.gg/uayQFhWC) **Come for the trees, stay for the memes!** ğŸŒ³ğŸ˜‚ - ğŸ†˜ **Get Help** - We actually answer! - ğŸ‰ **Share Wins** - Show off your directory art! - ğŸ› **Report Bugs** - We'll squash 'em! - ğŸŒŠ **Philosophy Hour** - Discuss waves with Omni in the hot tub! - ğŸ• **Pizza Fridays** - Virtual, but the fun is real! ### ğŸŒŸ Contributors Hall of Fame Special shoutouts to: - **Hue** - The visionary who started it all! ğŸ¨ - **Aye** - The AI that rocks! ğŸ¤– - **Trish from Accounting** - Our #1 fan and humor consultant! ğŸ’– - **Omni** - The philosopher in the hot tub! ğŸ› - **You** - Yes, YOU could be next! ğŸŒŸ ## ğŸ“œ The Sacred Scrolls (Documentation) - ğŸ“š **[Complete Guide](docs/MODE_SELECTION_GUIDE.md)** - Everything you need! - ğŸš€ **[MCP Integration](docs/mcp-guide.md)** - Make AI your friend! - ğŸ¯ **[Quick Reference](docs/mcp-quick-reference.md)** - Cheat sheet! - ğŸ¤” **[Philosophy](docs/OMNI_WISDOM.md)** - Deep thoughts from the hot tub! ## ğŸ¬ The Grand Finale ### Why Smart Tree? Because... **ğŸŒ³ Life's too short for boring directory listings!** **ğŸš€ Your directories deserve to be beautiful!** **ğŸ’° Your AI tokens are precious!** **ğŸ‰ Work should be fun!** --- *Smart Tree: Making directories great again, one visualization at a time!* **Built with ğŸ’™ by the Smart Tree Team** *Aye, Hue, Trish, and Omni approve this message!* âœ¨ --- **P.S. - If you read this far, you're awesome! Here's a secret: Try `st --semantic` and watch the magic happen! ğŸŒŠâœ¨** --- [FYI Section](FYI.md) ## Star History >By Request
rawDependencies:
=== Cargo.toml ===
[package]
name = "st"
version = "3.3.5"
edition = "2021"
authors = ["8bit-wraith", "Claude", "Omni", "8b-is Team"]
description = "Smart Tree - An intelligent, AI-friendly directory visualization tool"
repository = "https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree" # Updated repository
license = "MIT"
readme = "README.md"
keywords = ["tree", "directory", "visualization", "ai", "cli"]
categories = ["command-line-utilities", "filesystem"]

[dependencies]
clap = { version = "4.5", features = ["derive", "env"] }
clap_complete = "4.5"
clap_mangen = "0.2"
anyhow = "1.0"
walkdir = "2.5"
serde = { version = "1.0", features = ["derive"] }
serde_json = "1.0"
csv = "1.3"
chrono = "0.4"
flate2 = "1.0"
colored = "2.1"
globset = "0.4"
regex = "1.10"
humansize = "2.1"
rayon = "1.10"
indicatif = "0.17"
hex = "0.4"
sha2 = "0.10.9"
toml = "0.8.23"
dirs = "5.0"
libc = "0.2"
termimad = "0.26.1"
once_cell = "1.19"
base64 = "0.22"
rand = "0.8"


# MCP (Model Context Protocol) support
tokio = { version = "1.42", features = ["full"] }
async-trait = { version = "0.1" }
futures = { version = "0.3" }
dashmap = { version = "6.1" }
reqwest = { version = "0.12", default-features = false, features = ["json", "stream", "rustls-tls"] }
serde_yaml = "0.9"

# SSE support
notify = { version = "6.1", features = ["serde"] }
futures-util = "0.3"
tokio-stream = { version = "0.1", features = ["sync"] }

[[bin]]
name = "mq"
path = "src/bin/mq.rs"

[dev-dependencies]
tempfile = "3.10"
assert_cmd = "2.0"
predicates = "3.1"



[profile.release]
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
strip = true
opt-level = 3


=== package.json ===
{
  "name": "smart-tree",
  "version": "3.3.5",
  "description": "A blazingly fast, AI-friendly directory tree visualization tool written in Rust. Smart Tree goes beyond traditional tree commands by providing intelligent filtering, multiple output formats, and optimization for both human and AI consumption.",
  "main": "index.js",
  "directories": {
    "doc": "docs",
    "example": "examples"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree.git"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC",
  "type": "commonjs",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/8b-is/smart-tree#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/jest": "^30.0.0",
    "@types/node": "^24.0.7"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "ansi-styles": "^4.3.0",
    "braces": "^3.0.3",
    "chalk": "^4.1.2",
    "ci-info": "^4.2.0",
    "color-convert": "^2.0.1",
    "color-name": "^1.1.4",
    "escape-string-regexp": "^2.0.0",
    "expect": "^30.0.3",
    "fill-range": "^7.1.1",
    "graceful-fs": "^4.2.11",
    "has-flag": "^4.0.0",
    "is-number": "^7.0.0",
    "jest-diff": "^30.0.3",
    "jest-matcher-utils": "^30.0.3",
    "jest-message-util": "^30.0.2",
    "jest-mock": "^30.0.2",
    "jest-regex-util": "^30.0.1",
    "jest-util": "^30.0.2",
    "js-tokens": "^4.0.0",
    "micromatch": "^4.0.8",
    "picocolors": "^1.1.1",
    "picomatch": "^4.0.2",
    "pretty-format": "^30.0.2",
    "react-is": "^18.3.1",
    "slash": "^3.0.0",
    "stack-utils": "^2.0.6",
    "supports-color": "^7.2.0",
    "to-regex-range": "^5.0.1",
    "undici-types": "^7.8.0"
  }
}

=== test_files/package.json ===
